details.reason: The existing KB article states dealers can have separate feeds for new vs used inventory. The ticket resolution clarifies that as of Nov 12, 2025, dealers cannot create more than one feed ID per syndicator; instead the admin dashboard now provides per-syndicator checkboxes to select which inventory types (new/used/cpo/etc.) are included. The existing article is therefore outdated and should be updated to reflect the current behavior and admin workflow.

changes.title: Can We Have Separate Feeds for New vs Used Inventory?
changes.problem: A dealer wants to send separate new and used vehicle feeds to the same syndicator. Clarify whether multiple feeds or separate feed IDs per syndicator are supported and how to achieve inventory-type separation.
changes.solution: You cannot create more than one feed ID per syndicator. Instead, inventory separation (new vs used) is handled via inventory-type controls in the admin dashboard: for each syndicator you can select which inventory types to include using checkboxes. Configure those checkboxes to include only the inventory types you want the syndicator to receive.
steps: Log in to the admin dashboard.
Navigate to Syndicators (or the appropriate syndicator configuration page).
Select the syndicator (e.g., Syndicator_Export_1) you want to configure.
Locate the inventory-type checkboxes (typically labeled New, Used, CPO, etc.).
Check only the inventory types you want this syndicator to receive. Uncheck the others.
Save your changes. The single feed ID for that syndicator will now deliver only the selected inventory types.
If you need different inventory selections for multiple endpoints, contact support to discuss alternatives (e.g., different syndicator accounts or custom routing if available).

details.reason: Existing article (ID 6) states that the platform supports separate feeds for new vs used inventory. The resolution in the ticket clarifies current system behavior: we cannot create more than one feed ID per syndicator, but admins can control which inventory types (new/used) are included via checkboxes in the admin dashboard. This is a correction and improvement to the existing article and should replace the previous, potentially misleading statement.

changes.title: Troubleshooting Export Feed Not Updating (including verifying FTP credentials)
changes.problem: Export feed is not showing recent inventory changes or updates. In some cases the export process runs but the syndicator fails to ingest because of outdated or incorrect FTP credentials.
changes.solution: Check export status and connection, verify and if necessary update the FTP credentials in Admin Dashboard -> Export, test the FTP connection, and coordinate credential changes with the syndicator.
steps: Confirm the export job status and last successful run in the Admin Dashboard (Exports section).
Force an export/refresh if available to ensure latest data is generated.
Check server/export logs for errors or successful file generation and upload timestamps.
Verify the feed files were uploaded to the syndicator destination (FTP/SFTP) — check file timestamps and sizes.
Test FTP/SFTP connection to the syndicator using the credentials stored in Admin Dashboard -> Export (or use an FTP client).
If the connection fails or credentials are rejected, update the FTP username/password in Admin Dashboard -> Export with the latest credentials provided by the syndicator.
After updating credentials, attempt a manual export and test the FTP upload again to confirm success.
Notify the syndicator that credentials were updated and confirm they can access and ingest the latest files.
Monitor subsequent exports and confirm with the dealer that the feed updates resumed.
If problems persist, collect logs, error messages, and timestamps and escalate to platform/network team or syndicator support as needed.

details.reason: The existing article addresses feeds not updating but lacks the specific, actionable step discovered in this ticket: verifying and updating FTP credentials in Admin Dashboard -> Export and coordinating credential updates with the syndicator. The ticket shows the export itself was functioning but outdated credentials prevented syndicator ingestion. Updating the existing KB to include explicit credential checks, testing, and outreach steps will make the article more complete and increase its effectiveness.

details.title: Troubleshooting When Export Feed Is Up but Syndicator Isn't Ingesting (Syndicator_Export_4)
details.reason: Existing KB article focuses on verifying FTP credentials when an export feed is not updating. This ticket describes a different root cause — the syndicator's ingestion/end system was the problem despite correct FTP setup. The knowledge base lacks a specific troubleshooting and escalation playbook for cases where the feed export is confirmed working but the syndicator fails to ingest or update. Creating a new article for syndicator-side failures (including steps to confirm export health, gather evidence, contact syndicator support, and communicate with the dealer) will fill this gap.
